igdectk.rest package¶

Submodules¶

igdectk.rest.csrf module¶

Advanced CSRF middleware for django.

class igdectk.rest.csrf.CsrfViewMiddleware[source]¶

Bases: object

Middleware that requires a present and correct csrfmiddlewaretoken for POST/PUT/DELETE requests that have a CSRF cookie, and sets an outgoing CSRF cookie. This middleware should be used in conjunction with the csrf_token template tag. The CSRF cookie rotate after it was consumed. That mean the client side must takes care to always sending the latest value of the cookie.

process_response(request, response)[source]¶
process_view(request, callback, callback_args, callback_kwargs)[source]¶

igdectk.rest.handler module¶

Easy manage RESTfull urls and views according to the HTTP method and content format.

class igdectk.rest.handler.InlineRestHandler(regex, name, app_name=None, version='1.0')[source]¶

Bases: object

class igdectk.rest.handler.RestForm[source]¶

Bases: object

Rest handler to register a form with GET and POST method and HTML format.

Variables:
  • form_class (django.forms.Form) – Django formular class.
  • form_template (str) – Complete name of the template used to render the formular.
  • form_template_name (str) – Name of the template form variable. Default is ‘form’.
  • auth (boolean) – True if the user must be authenticated. Default False.
  • admin (boolean) – True if the user must be a super-user. Default False.
  • redirect (boolean) – If True, when form POST success the client is redirected to success location.
  • success (str) – If redirect is True success defines the location URL to the redirection when form POST success. If False, success defines the template name to render.
admin = False¶
auth = False¶
form_class = None¶
form_template = ''¶
form_template_name = 'form'¶
classmethod get(request, form)[source]¶

Method to override when it is necessary to perform initialization on the form before sending it to the client.

It is permit to raise an exception here.

classmethod invalid_form(request, form)[source]¶

Method to override to use the result of the form, when it failed to pass the django form validation tests. For example highlight some fields, display an error message..

It is permit to raise an exception here.

redirect = True¶
success = '/'¶
classmethod valid_form(request, form)[source]¶

Method to override to use the result of the form, when it pass the django form validation tests. For example updating a model.

If False is returned the form page is returned to the client.

It is permit to raise an exception here.

class igdectk.rest.handler.RestHandler[source]¶

Bases: object

Manage RESTfull API with autogenenation and registration of urls.

Variables:
  • regex (str) – Python regular expression of the URL. It is combined with its parent handler regex when using inheritance of handlers.
  • name (str) – Qualified name of the URL to be used into reverse URL and templates. It is possible to omit it and use suffix when using inheritance.
  • suffix (str) – When inherit of a parent handler (excepted RestHandler base class), and if name is empty or None, suffix is added to the URL name of its parent. It is useful to avoid the rewriting of the complete path name. There is no need to add a separator before.
  • name_separator (str) – Separator used between each word into the URL name. Default is ‘-‘.
  • app_name (str) – Application name. If None it is detect from the module where the class is defined.
app_name = None¶
application = None¶
classmethod def_admin_request(method, format, parameters=(), content=(), fallback=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Same as def_request() but in addition the user must be authenticated and superuser.

Parameters:fallback (func) – Optional callback function called in case the user is not authenticated.
classmethod def_auth_request(method, format, parameters=(), content=(), fallback=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Same as def_request() but in addition the user must be authenticated.

Parameters:fallback (func) – Optional callback function called in case the user is not authenticated.
classmethod def_request(method, format, parameters=(), content=(), **kwargs)[source]¶

Request function register and wrapper for non auth requests.

Check the list of mandatory URL parameters.

Check the list of mandatory content Form/JSON parameters, or validate the content using validictory format.

If the format is incorrect or a parameter is missing raise a ViewException HTML or JSON depending of the format.

If it pass the test, the function will contains two news parameters :
  • method : from the decorator
  • format : from the decorator
Parameters:
  • method (igdectk.rest.Method) – One of the Method value (GET, POST...) define the accepted method.
  • format (igdectk.rest.Format) – One of the Format value (JSON, HTML...) defines the format of the http response, and the accepted value from HTTP_ACCEPT.
  • parameters (list) – A list of strings or an empty list, containing the names of the mandatory parameters requested in the URL.
  • list (list(str)) – A list of strings or an empty list, containing the names of the mandatory parameters requested in the body.
  • conditions (string) –

    The next parameters if theirs names starts with a ‘url__‘ will be used as condition expression for the url parameters.

    For example, having url__action=’save’ mean that the url must contains the parameter action with the value ‘save’.

    This is useful to have many action for a same HTTP method. It is possible to have many ‘url__‘ conditions.

Note

Only a single free of conditions method per handler can be registered. Otherwise a RestRegistrationException exception is raised.

handlers = {}¶
methods = {}¶
name = ''¶
name_separator = '-'¶
regex = ''¶
static register_urls()[source]¶

This method must be called once time in the urls.py

suffix = ''¶
unprocessed_handlers = []¶

exception igdectk.rest.handler.RestRegistrationException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Occurs during registration of a handler or a method into a REST handler.

igdectk.rest.handler.def_inline_request(inline_handler, method, format, parameters=(), content=(), **kwargs)[source]¶

Request function register and wrapper for non auth requests.

Check the list of mandatory URL parameters.

Check the list of mandatory content Form/JSON parameters, or validate the content using validictory format.

If the format is incorrect or a parameter is missing raise a ViewException HTML or JSON depending of the format.

If it pass the test, the function will contains two news parameters :
  • method : from the decorator
  • format : from the decorator
Parameters:
  • method (igdectk.rest.Method) – One of the Method value (GET, POST...) define the accepted method.
  • format (igdectk.rest.Format) – One of the Format value (JSON, HTML...) defines the format of the http response, and the accepted value from HTTP_ACCEPT.
  • parameters (list) – A list of strings or an empty list, containing the names of the mandatory parameters requested in the URL.
  • list (list(str)) – A list of strings or an empty list, containing the names of the mandatory parameters requested in the body.
  • conditions (string) –

    The next parameters if theirs names starts with a ‘url__‘ will be used as condition expression for the url parameters.

    For example, having url__action=’save’ mean that the url must contains the parameter action with the value ‘save’.

    This is useful to have many action for a same HTTP method. It is possible to have many ‘url__‘ conditions.

Note

Only a single free of conditions method per handler can be registered. Otherwise a RestRegistrationException exception is raised.

igdectk.rest.response module¶

Usefull common responses.

class igdectk.rest.response.ComplexEncoder(skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, default=None)[source]¶

Bases: json.encoder.JSONEncoder

Support standard json dumps plus serializers for django query set and model object.

default(obj)[source]¶
igdectk.rest.response.HttpResponseRest(request, data)[source]¶

Return an Http response into the correct output format (JSON, XML or HTML), according of the request.format parameters.

Format is automaticaly added when using the igdectk.rest.restmiddleware.IGdecTkRestMiddleware and views decorators.

igdectk.rest.restmiddleware module¶

Middleware thats manage common view errors. The middleware decorate the request with a format (HTML by default), and by a list of URL parameters. When a view is decorated by def_request or def_auth_request, this modify the data attached to the request and the format.

class igdectk.rest.restmiddleware.HttpHeader(request)[source]¶

Bases: object

HTTP header parser with cache.

accept¶

Returns the HTTP_ACCEPT list of pairs (media_type, q_value). This list is cached the first time.

accept_language¶

Returns the HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE as a list of pairs. This list is cached the first time.

accepted_language_codes¶

Sames as accept_language but returns only the languages codes. This list is cached the first time.

accepted_types¶

Sames as accept but returns only the media_type. This list is cached the first time.

content_format¶

Returns a Format for the content type.

content_type¶

Returns a pair with content type and a tuples of content settings.

prefered_type¶

Get the prefered media_type as Format enum.

class igdectk.rest.restmiddleware.HttpResponseUnauthorized(content=b'', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.http.response.HttpResponse

status_code = 401¶
class igdectk.rest.restmiddleware.IGdecTkRestMiddleware[source]¶

Bases: object

Middleware that manages request format and catch views exceptions. It also manage the customized view errors (page if HTML else JSON).

The middleware decorate the request with a format (HTML by default), and by a list of URL parameters.

When a view is decorated by igdectk.rest.handler.RestHandler.def_request(), igdectk.rest.handler.RestHandler.def_auth_request() or by igdectk.rest.handler.RestHandler.def_admin_request(), the decorator can attach a data dict to the request object.

TYPES = {400: <class 'django.http.response.HttpResponseBadRequest'>, 401: <class 'igdectk.rest.restmiddleware.HttpResponseUnauthorized'>, 404: <class 'django.http.response.HttpResponseNotFound'>, 500: <class 'django.http.response.HttpResponseServerError'>}¶
static format_response(request, message, code)[source]¶

Helper to format a response related to the format and parameters defined into the request, a message, and an HTTP code.

Parameters:
  • request (RequestContext) – Django request object.
  • message (str) – Message contant string.
  • code (int) – HTTP code.
Returns:

An HTTP response object.
Return type:

HttpResponse
